element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm takes an image and a vector layer with polygons representing trees, and automatically detects other trees in the images. It performs supervised classification to detect pixels that might belong to a tree, and then classifes clusters of such pixels depending on the area they cover. Both pixel spectral signature and cluster area have to be similar to signature and area of polygons used as training features.

element.name: INPUT
element.text: The bands to use to classify pixels

element.name: POLYGONS
element.text: A polygon layer with polygons representing trees.

element.name: TOLERANCE_SPECTRAL
element.text: The tolerance (t) to use for spectral classification. If the distance to the average value of tree pixels is lower than t times the standard deviation of tree pixel values in training areas, then the pixel is classified as a tree pixel.

element.name: TOLERANCE_SIZE
element.text: The tolerance to apply to size values.

element.name: TREES
element.text: A points layer with points placed on the center of each detected tree center. The attributes table contains a radius value, which can be used to created a circular buffer representing the tree, and a shape coefficient, indicating how similar the shape of the cluster of pixel trees is to the shape of a circle.
